H0.text: The amount of oxygen increases as a result of deforestation's effect on Earth's atmosphere.

H1.text: The amount of methane increases as a result of deforestationâ€™s effect on Earth's atmosphere.

H2.text: The amount of water vapor increases when deforestation has an effect on Earth's atmosphere.

H3.text: The amount of carbon dioxide increases when deforestation affects Earth's atmosphere.

A4.text: The incineration and burning of forest plants to clear land releases large amounts of CO2, which contributes to global warming.

A5.text: Rainforests contribute little net oxygen to the Earth's atmosphere, so deforestation has only a minor effect on atmospheric oxygen levels.
